text.value: We discussed obtaining the filename without the extension in Node.js using the path module. By utilizing path.basename() along with path.extname(), you can effectively remove the extension from the filename. The process involves extracting the directory path with path.dirname(), then using path.basename(filePath, path.extname(filePath)) to get the filename without the extension. This method involves path.extname(filePath) to determine the extension and remove it correctly.

- path.extname(filePath) returns the extension of the filename, including the dot (e.g., .txt).- By passing the extension returned by path.extname(filePath) as the second argument to path.basename(filePath, extension), it tells the method to remove that extension from the filename it returns.

As a result, fileNameWithoutExt will contain just the filename without its extension, fulfilling your requirement.
